page.title: 04The Pilkingtons of St.Helens
page.content: Windle Hall is the home of the Pilkington family. Originally there was a very old house on the site but a new house was built by{Dr. William {Pilkington}about 120 years ago. The doctor invested his considerable wealth in the then developing glass industry but it was his two sons { {William}and{Richard}who bought out local glass factories and established the{Pilkingtons Glass Company. Pilkingtons are one of the worlds leading glass manufacturers.{Lady {Mavis}now lives at Windle Hall which has a dining room, 2 sitting rooms, a hall, a sunlounge and ten bedrooms. Lady Mavis is president of the St Helens Rugby League Club. She has several gardeners and housekeepers. The rose gardens were built on the site of an old banqueting hall. They are sometimes open to the public.
